required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Two Devices Using Near-infra Red Spectroscopy During a Vascular Occlusion Test
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Two Devices Using Near-infra Red Spectroscopy for the Measurement of Tissue Oxygenation During a Vascular Occlusion Test (INVOS® Versus Inspectra™)

brief_summary.textblock: Tissue oxygen saturation is non-invasively measured using near-infrared spectroscopy, by two device, INVOS®(somanetics Corporation, USA ) and InSpectra™ (Hutchinson Technology, USA). Each probes are attached to both thenar muscles and vascular occlusion test (VOT) is performed. The investigators will compare the Invos® data to InSpectra™ to investigate whether tissue oxygen saturation values by INVOS® can substitute for InSpectra™.

detailed_description.textblock:
Tissue oxygen saturation is non-invasively measured using near-infrared spectroscopy, by two device, INVOS®(somanetics Corporation, USA ) and InSpectra™ (Hutchinson Technology, USA). InSpectra™ was introduced later than INVOS®.
With InSpectra™, clinicians have used a vascular occlusion test (VOT) to evaluate dynamic changes in tissue oxygen saturation during ischemia and reperfusion, and thus, microcirculatory function. There have been little data about VOT using INVOS®, although it is more popular device.
We hypothesized that there would be a difference between the values from INVOS® and InSpectra™. The aim of this study is to evaluate changes in tissue oxygen saturation in the thenar muscle during VOT using INVOS® and comapre it to InSpectra™ in a normal population.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Tissue Oxygenation Value During Ischemia and Reperfusion Period Until Basline Value Was Achieved
primary_outcome.time_frame: Until basline tissue oxygenation value was achieved
primary_outcome.description: During vascular occlusion test, the changes of StO2 and SrO2 values can divided into 3 epoch; Desaturation, Reoxygenation and Reactive hyperemia. After data collection, the rate of desaturation and reoxygenation were calculated.

primary_outcome.measure: Sum of Tissue Oxygenation Value Which Above Basline Value After Reperfusion Period Until Basline Value Was Achieved
primary_outcome.time_frame: Until basline tissue oxygenation value was achieved
primary_outcome.description: During vascular occlusion test, the changes of StO2 and SrO2 values can divided into 3 epoch; Desaturation, Reoxygenation and Reactive hyperemia. After data collection, the rate of desaturation and reoxygenation were calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline, Miminum and Maximum Tissue Oxygenation Value Measured by INVOS® (SrO2) Until Basline Value Was Achieved
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until basline tissue oxygenation value was achieved
secondary_outcome.description: Before VOT. basline StO2 and SrO2 were recorded and compared each other. During VOT, minimum/maximum StO2 and SrO2 were also recorded and compared each other.

arm_group.description: The pediatric SomaSensor™ probe of INVOS® and the 15-mm sensor of InSpectra™ are placed on each thenar muscle in the same subject. The side on which the probe will be placed is randomly determined. INVOS® updates data every 5 s and data (SrO2) will be manually recorded. The data of InSpectra™ (StO2) are automatically collected and sampled every 2 s. Vascular occlusion test (VOT) is done as follows:Adult-size blood pressure cuffs are placed around each upper arm. The both cuffs are simultaneously inflated to 30 mmHg above the initial systolic blood pressure and kept inflated until the SrO2 or StO2 decreased to 40%. When the value reaches 40% or just below it, the cuff on the same side is deflated rapidly. The data will be collected until the SrO2 and StO2 values returned to the baseline.

intervention.description: Using Invos® probe attacted to one thenar muscle, tissue oxgyenation is measured by VOT.
Using Inspectra™ probe attacted to another thenar muscle, tissue oxgyenation is measured by VOT.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy subject
Exclusion Criteria:
- age under 18 years old
- with arteriovenous fistula
- with peripheral vessel disease
- taking vasoactive drug
- with a skin ailment
- with HTN, DM
- with diagnosed heart disease

group.title: Vascular Occlusion Test
group.description: The pediatric SomaSensor™ probe of INVOS® and the 15-mm sensor of InSpectra™ are placed on each thenar muscle in the same subject. The side on which the probe will be placed is randomly determined. INVOS® updates data every 5 s and data (SrO2) will be manually recorded. The data of InSpectra™ (StO2) are automatically collected and sampled every 2 s. Vascular occlusion test (VOT) is done as follows:Adult-size blood pressure cuffs are placed around each upper arm. The both cuffs are simultaneously inflated to 30 mmHg above the initial systolic blood pressure and kept inflated until the SrO2 or StO2 decreased to 40%. When the value reaches 40% or just below it, the cuff on the same side is deflated rapidly. The data will be collected until the SrO2 and StO2 values returned to the baseline.

group.title: Vascular Occlusion Test
group.description: The pediatric SomaSensor™ probe of INVOS® and the 15-mm sensor of InSpectra™ are placed on each thenar muscle in the same subject. The side on which the probe will be placed is randomly determined. INVOS® updates data every 5 s and data (SrO2) will be manually recorded. The data of InSpectra™ (StO2) are automatically collected and sampled every 2 s. Vascular occlusion test (VOT) is done as follows:Adult-size blood pressure cuffs are placed around each upper arm. The both cuffs are simultaneously inflated to 30 mmHg above the initial systolic blood pressure and kept inflated until the SrO2 or StO2 decreased to 40%. When the value reaches 40% or just below it, the cuff on the same side is deflated rapidly. The data will be collected until the SrO2 and StO2 values returned to the baseline.

outcome.title: Change of Tissue Oxygenation Value During Ischemia and Reperfusion Period Until Basline Value Was Achieved
outcome.description: During vascular occlusion test, the changes of StO2 and SrO2 values can divided into 3 epoch; Desaturation, Reoxygenation and Reactive hyperemia. After data collection, the rate of desaturation and reoxygenation were calculated.
outcome.time_frame: Until basline tissue oxygenation value was achieved

group.title: INVOS®
group.description: Data from INVOS® during VOT were manually recorded. Desaturation and reoxygenation rate were calculated and compared to InSpectra™ .

group.title: InSpectra™
group.description: Data from InSpectra™ during VOT were manually recorded. Desaturation and reoxygenation rate were calculated and compared to INVOS®.

measure.title: Change of Tissue Oxygenation Value During Ischemia and Reperfusion Period Until Basline Value Was Achieved
measure.description: During vascular occlusion test, the changes of StO2 and SrO2 values can divided into 3 epoch; Desaturation, Reoxygenation and Reactive hyperemia. After data collection, the rate of desaturation and reoxygenation were calculated.

analysis.groups_desc: Unpaired t-test was used to compare the difference between SrO2 and StO2.

outcome.title: Baseline, Miminum and Maximum Tissue Oxygenation Value Measured by INVOS® (SrO2) Until Basline Value Was Achieved
outcome.description: Before VOT. basline StO2 and SrO2 were recorded and compared each other. During VOT, minimum/maximum StO2 and SrO2 were also recorded and compared each other.
outcome.time_frame: Until basline tissue oxygenation value was achieved

group.title: INVOS®
group.description: Basline value before VOT,and minimum/ maximum values of INVOS® were obtained and compared to InSpectra™ .

group.title: InSpectra™
group.description: Basline value before VOT,and minimum/ maximum values of InSpectra™ were obtained and compared to INVOS®.

measure.title: Baseline, Miminum and Maximum Tissue Oxygenation Value Measured by INVOS® (SrO2) Until Basline Value Was Achieved
measure.description: Before VOT. basline StO2 and SrO2 were recorded and compared each other. During VOT, minimum/maximum StO2 and SrO2 were also recorded and compared each other.

outcome.description: During vascular occlusion test, the changes of StO2 and SrO2 values can divided into 3 epoch; Desaturation, Reoxygenation and Reactive hyperemia. After data collection, the rate of desaturation and reoxygenation were calculated.
outcome.time_frame: Until basline tissue oxygenation value was achieved

group.title: INVOS®
group.description: Data from INVOS® during VOT were manually recorded. Reactive hyperemic area were calculated and compared to InSpectra™ .

group.title: InSpectra™
group.description: Data from InSpectra™ during VOT were manually recorded. Reactive hyperemic area were calculated and compared to INVOS®.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
